casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Christina Shea WALTERS 548A00-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. December 27, 2018 Shelagh R. Kenney, Attorney at Law, Malcolm Ray Hunter, Jr., Attorney at Law, for Walters, Christina Shea Danielle Marquis Elder, Special Deputy Attorney General, Jonathan P. Babb, Special Counsel to Attorney General, William R. West, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina James E. Williams, Jr., Attorney at Law, Carrboro, for N.C. Advocates for Justice James E. Coleman, Jr., Attorney at Law, for Becton, Charles, et al. Robert P. Mosteller, Attorney at Law, for Professors John Charles Boger & Robert P. Mosteller Grady Jessup, Attorney at Law, Durham, for N.C. Association of Black Lawyers *588Lisa A. Bakale-Wise, Attorney at Law, Irving Joyner, Attorney at Law, Durham, for N.C. State Conference of the NAACP Edward Joseph Blocher, Jr., Attorney at Law, for Social Scientists Janet Moore, Attorney at Law, for National Association for Public Defense Carlos E. Mahoney, Attorney at Law, Durham, Jin Hee Lee, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, W. Kerrel Murray, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Inc. Cynthia F. Adcock, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Council of Churches Burton Craige, Attorney at Law, For N.C. Advocates for Justice Jeremy M. Falcone, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Paul F. Khoury, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, Robert L. Walker, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, Madeline J. Cohen, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Former State and Federal Prosecutors

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Reply Brief filed on the 21st of December 2018 by Defendant:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 27th of December 2018."

Defendant shall have up to and including the 1st day of February 2019 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
